data.name: AutocleanupLong
data.value: If a backup is interrupted there will likely be partial files present on the backend. Using this flag, Duplicati will automatically remove such files when encountered.

data.name: AutocleanupShort
data.value: A flag indicating that Duplicati should remove unused files

data.name: PrefixLong
data.value: A string used to prefix the filenames of the remote volumes, can be used to store multiple backups in the same remote folder.

data.name: PrefixShort
data.value: Remote filename prefix

data.name: DisablefiletimecheckLong
data.value: The operating system keeps track of the last time a file was written. Using this information, Duplicati can quickly determine if the file has been modified. If some application deliberately modifies this information, Duplicati won't work correctly unless this flag is set.

data.name: DisablefiletimecheckShort
data.value: Disable checks based on file time

data.name: RestorepathLong
data.value: By default, files will be restored in the source folders, use this option to restore to another folder

data.name: RestorepathShort
data.value: Restore to another folder

data.name: AllowsleepShort
data.value: Allow system to enter sleep power modes for inactivity during backup/restore operations (Windows only)

data.name: ThrottledownloadLong
data.value: By setting this value you can limit how much bandwidth Duplicati consumes for downloads. Setting this limit can make the backups take longer, but will make Duplicati less intrusive.

data.name: ThrottledownloadShort
data.value: Max number of bytes to download pr. second

data.name: ThrottleuploadLong
data.value: By setting this value you can limit how much bandwidth Duplicati consumes for uploads. Setting this limit can make the backups take longer, but will make Duplicati less intrusive.

data.name: ThrottleuploadShort
data.value: Max number of bytes to upload pr. second

data.name: NoencryptionLong
data.value: If you store the backups on a local disk, and prefer that they are kept unencrypted, you can turn of encryption completely by using this switch.

data.name: NoencryptionShort
data.value: Disable encryption

data.name: NumberofretriesLong
data.value: If an upload or download fails, Duplicati will retry a number of times before failing. Use this to handle unstable network connections better.

data.name: NumberofretriesShort
data.value: Number of times to retry a failed transmission

data.name: PassphraseLong
data.value: Supply a passphrase that Duplicati will use to encrypt the backup volumes, making them unreadable without the passphrase. This variable can also be supplied through the environment variable PASSPHRASE.

data.name: PassphraseShort
data.value: Passphrase used to encrypt backups

data.name: TimeLong
data.value: By default, Duplicati will list and restore files from the most recent backup, use this option to select another item. You may use relative times, like "-2M" for a backup from two months ago.

data.name: TimeShort
data.value: The time to list/restore files

data.name: VersionLong
data.value: By default, Duplicati will list and restore files from the most recent backup, use this option to select another item. You may enter multiple values separated with comma, and ranges using -, e.g. "0,2-4,7" .

data.name: VersionShort
data.value: The version to list/restore files

data.name: AllversionsLong
data.value: When searching for files, only the most recent backup is searched. Use this option to show all previous versions too.

data.name: AllversionsShort
data.value: Show all versions

data.name: RetrydelayLong
data.value: After a failed transmission, Duplicati will wait a short period before attempting again. This is usefull if the network drops out occasionally during transmissions.

data.name: RetrydelayShort
data.value: Time to wait between retries

data.name: ControlfilesLong
data.value: Use this option to attach extra files to the newly uploaded filelists.

data.name: ControlfilesShort
data.value: Set control files

data.name: SkipfilehashchecksLong
data.value: If the hash for the volume does not match, Duplicati will refuse to use the backup. Supply this flag to allow Duplicati to proceed anyway.

data.name: SkipfilehashchecksShort
data.value: Set this flag to skip hash checks

data.name: SkipfileslargerthanLong
data.value: This option allows you to exclude files that are larger than the given value. Use this to prevent backups becoming extremely large.

data.name: SkipfileslargerthanShort
data.value: Limit the size of files being backed up

data.name: TempdirLong
data.value: Duplicati will use the system default temporary folder. This option can be used to supply an alternative folder for temporary storage.

data.name: TempdirShort
data.value: Temporary storage folder

data.name: ThreadpriorityLong
data.value: Selects another thread priority for the process. Use this to set Duplicati to be more or less CPU intensive.

data.name: ThreadpriorityShort
data.value: Thread priority

data.name: DblocksizeLong
data.value: This option can change the maximum size of dblock files. Changing the size can be useful if the backend has a limit on the size of each individual file

data.name: DblocksizeShort
data.value: Limit the size of the volumes

data.name: DisableStreamingLong
data.value: Enabling this option will disallow usage of the streaming interface, which means that transfer progress bars will not show, and bandwidth throttle settings will be ignored.

data.name: DisableStreamingShort
data.value: Disables use of the streaming transfer method

data.name: DontreadmanifestsLong
data.value: This option will make sure the contents of the manifest file are not read. This also implies that file hashes are not checked either. Use only for disaster recovery.

data.name: DontreadmanifestsShort
data.value: An option that prevents verifying the manifests

data.name: CompressionmoduleLong
data.value: Duplicati supports plugable compression modules. Use this option to select a module to use for compression. This is only applied when creating new volumes, when reading an existing file, the filename is used to select the compression module.

data.name: CompressionmoduleShort
data.value: Select what module to use for compression

data.name: EncryptionmoduleLong
data.value: Duplicati supports plugable encryption modules. Use this option to select a module to use for encryption. This is only applied when creating new volumes, when reading an existing file, the filename is used to select the encryption module.

data.name: EncryptionmoduleShort
data.value: Select what module to use for encryption

data.name: DisablemoduleLong
data.value: Supply one or more module names, separated by commas to unload them

data.name: DisablemoduleShort
data.value: Disabled one or more modules

data.name: EnablemoduleLong
data.value: Supply one or more module names, separated by commas to load them

data.name: EnablemoduleShort
data.value: Enables one or more modules

data.name: SnapshotpolicyLong
data.value: This settings controls the usage of snapshots, which allows Duplicati to backup files that are locked by other programs. If this is set to "off", Duplicati will not attempt to create a disk snapshot. Setting this to "auto" makes Duplicati attempt to create a snapshot, and fail silently if that was not allowed or supported. A setting of "on" will also make Duplicati attempt to create a snapshot, but will produce a warning message in the log if it fails. Setting it to "required" will make Duplicati abort the backup if the snapshot creation fails. On windows this uses the Volume Shadow Copy Services (VSS) and requires administrative privileges. On linux this uses Logical Volume Management (LVM) and requires root privileges.

data.name: SnapshotpolicyShort
data.value: Controls the use of disk snapshots

data.name: AsynchronousuploadfolderLong
data.value: The pre-generated volumes will be placed into the temporary folder by default, this option can set a different folder for placing the temporary volumes, despite the name, this also works for synchronous runs

data.name: AsynchronousuploadfolderShort
data.value: The path where ready volumes are placed until uploaded

data.name: AsynchronousuploadlimitLong
data.value: When performing asynchronous uploads, Duplicati will create volumes that can be uploaded. To prevent Duplicati from generating too many volumes, this option limits the number of pending uploads. Set to zero to disable the limit

data.name: AsynchronousuploadlimitShort
data.value: The number of volumes to create ahead of time

data.name: DebugoutputLong
data.value: Activating this option will make some error messages more verbose, which may help you track down a particular issue

data.name: DebugoutputShort
data.value: Enables debugging output

data.name: LogfileLong
data.value: Specifies the name of a while into which internal log information is written

data.name: LogfileShort
data.value: Log internal information

data.name: LoglevelLong
data.value: Specifies the amount of log information to write into the file specified by --log-file

data.name: LoglevelShort
data.value: Log information level

data.name: DisableautocreatefolderLong
data.value: If Duplicati detects that the target folder is missing, it will create it automatically. Activate this option to prevent automatic folder creation.

data.name: DisableautocreatefolderShort
data.value: Disables automatic folder creation

data.name: VssexcludewritersLong
data.value: Use this option to exclude faulty writers from a snapshot. This is equivalent to the -wx flag of the vshadow.exe tool, except that it only accepts writer class GUIDs, and not component names or instance GUIDs. Multiple GUIDs must be separated with a semicolon, and most forms of GUIDs are allowed, including with and without curly braces.

data.name: VssexcludewritersShort
data.value: A semicolon separated list of guids of VSS writers to exclude (Windows only)

data.name: UsnpolicyLong
data.value: This settings controls the usage of NTFS USN numbers, which allows Duplicati to obtain a list of files and folders much faster. If this is set to "off", Duplicati will not attempt to use USN. Setting this to "auto" makes Duplicati attempt to use USN, and fail silently if that was not allowed or supported. A setting of "on" will also make Duplicati attempt to use USN, but will produce a warning message in the log if it fails. Setting it to "required" will make Duplicati abort the backup if the USN usage fails. This feature is only supported on Windows and requires administrative privileges.

data.name: UsnpolicyShort
data.value: Controls the use of NTFS Update Sequence Numbers

data.name: DisableusndiffcheckLong
data.value: If USN is enabled the USN numbers are used to find all changed files since last backup. Use this option to disable the use of USN numbers, which will make Duplicati investigate all source files. This option is primarily intended for testing and should not be disabled in a production environment. If USN is not enabled, this option has no effect.

data.name: DisableusndiffcheckShort
data.value: Disables changelist by USN numbers

data.name: DisabletimetoleranceLong
data.value: When deciding if a full backup should be made or an old backup should be deleted, Duplicati will adjust the times by a small fraction to ensure that minor time differences do not interfer with expected operation. If the backup is set to produce a full backup each day, and a full backup is made at, say 12:00:01, and the backup is executed again at 12:00:00, a full day has not passed and thus an incremental backup is performed. To avoid this, Duplicati inserts a 1% tolerance (max 1 hour). Use this option to disable the tolerance, and use strict time checking

data.name: DisabletimetoleranceShort
data.value: Deactivates tolerance when comparing times

data.name: ListverifyuploadsLong
data.value: Some protocols, like FTP, and some servers have problems detecting an interrupted transfer and will assume that the transfer completed, even if it did not. If this option is enabled Duplicati will list the contents of the backend after each upload and verify that the file exists and has the expected size.

data.name: ListverifyuploadsShort
data.value: Verify uploads by listing contents

data.name: SynchronousuploadLong
data.value: Duplicati will upload files while scanning the disk and producing volumes, which usually makes the backup faster. Use this flag to turn the behavior off, so that Duplicati will wait for each volume to complete.

data.name: SynchronousuploadShort
data.value: Upload files synchronously

data.name: NoconnectionreuseLong
data.value: Duplicati will attempt to perform multiple operations on a single connection, as this avoids repeated login attempts, and thus speeds up the process. This option can be used to ensure that each operation is performed on a seperate connection

data.name: NoconnectionreuseShort
data.value: Do not re-use connections

data.name: DebugretryerrorsLong
data.value: When an error occurs, Duplicati will silently retry, and only report the number of retries. Enable this option to have the error messages displayed when a retry is performed.

data.name: DebugretryerrorsShort
data.value: Show error messages when a retry is performed

data.name: UploadUnchangedBackupsLong
data.value: If no files have changed, Duplicati will not upload a backup set. If the backup data is used to verify that a backup was executed, this option will make Duplicati upload a backupset even if it is empty

data.name: UploadUnchangedBackupsShort
data.value: Upload empty backup files

data.name: QuotasizeLong
data.value: This value can be used to set a known upper limit on the amount of space a backend has. If the backend reports the size itself, this value is ignored

data.name: QuotasizeShort
data.value: A reported maximum storage

data.name: SymlinkpolicyShort
data.value: Symlink handling

data.name: SymlinkpolicyLong
data.value: Using this option to handle symlinks different. The "{0}" option will simply record a symlink with its name and destination, and a restore will recreate the symlink as a link. Use the option "{1}" to ignore all symlinks and not store any information about them. Previous versions of Duplicati used the setting "{2}", which will cause symlinked files to be included and restore as normal files.

data.name: ExcludefilesattributesShort
data.value: Exclude files by attribute

data.name: ExcludefilesattributesLong
data.value: Use this option to exclude files with certain attributes. Use a comma separated list of attribute names to specify more that one. Possible values are: {0}

data.name: VssusemappingLong
data.value: Activate this option to map VSS snapshots to a drive (similar to SUBST, using Win32 DefineDosDevice). This will create temporary drives that are then used to access the contents of a snapshot. This workaround can speed up file access on Windows XP.

data.name: VssusemappingShort
data.value: Map snapshots to a drive (Windows only)

data.name: BackupnameLong
data.value: A display name that is attached to this backup. Can be used to identify the backup when sending mail or running scripts.

data.name: BackupnameShort
data.value: Name of the backup

data.name: CompressionextensionfileLong
data.value: This property can be used to point to a text file where each line contains a file extension that indicates a non-compressible file. Files that have an extension found in the file will not be compressed, but simply stored in the archive. The file format ignores any lines that do not start with a period, and considers a space to indicate the end of the extension. A default file is supplied, that also serves as an example. The default file is placed in {0}.

data.name: CompressionextensionfileShort
data.value: Manage non-compressible file extensions

data.name: BlockhashlookupsizeLong
data.value: A fragment of memory is used to reduce database lookups. You should not change this value unless you get warnings in the log.

data.name: BlockhashlookupsizeShort
data.value: Memory used by the block hash

data.name: BlocksizeLong
data.value: The blocksize determines how files are fragmented. Choosing a large value will cause a larger overhead on file changes, choosing a small value will cause a large overhead on storage of file lists. Note that the value cannot be changed after remote files are created.

data.name: BlocksizeShort
data.value: Blocksize used in hashing

data.name: ChangedfilesLong
data.value: This option can be used to limit the scan to only files that are known to have changed. This is usually only activated in combination with a filesystem watcher that keeps track of file changes.

data.name: ChangedfilesShort
data.value: List of files to examine for changes

data.name: DbpathLong
data.value: Path to the file containing the local cache of the remote file database

data.name: DbpathShort
data.value: Path to the local state database

data.name: DeletedfilesLong
data.value: This option can be used to supply a list of deleted files. This option will be ignored unless the option --{0} is also set.

data.name: DeletedfilesShort
data.value: List of deleted files

data.name: FilehashlookupsizeLong
data.value: A fragment of memory is used to reduce database lookups. You should not change this value unless you get warnings in the log.

data.name: FilehashlookupsizeShort
data.value: Memory used by the file hash

data.name: DisablefilepathcacheShort
data.value: This option can be used to reduce the memory footprint by not keeping paths and scantimes in memory

data.name: DisablefilepathcacheLong
data.value: Reduce memory footprint by disabling in-memory lookups

data.name: StoremetadataLong
data.value: Stores metadata, such as file timestamps and attributes. This increases the required storage space as well as the processing time.

data.name: StoremetadataShort
data.value: Enables storing file metadata

data.name: MetadatahashlookupsizeLong
data.value: A fragment of memory is used to reduce database lookups. You should not change this value unless you get warnings in the log.

data.name: MetadatahashlookupsizeShort
data.value: Memory used by the metadata hash

data.name: NobackendverificationLong
data.value: If this flag is set, the local database is not compared to the remote filelist on startup. The intended usage for this option is to work correctly in cases where the filelisting is broken or unavailable.

data.name: NobackendverificationShort
data.value: Do not query backend at startup

data.name: IndexfilepolicyLong
data.value: The index files are used to limit the need for downloading dblock files when there is no local database present. The more information is recorded in the index files, the faster operations can proceed without the database. The tradeoff is that larger index files take up more remote space and which may never be used.

data.name: IndexfilepolicyShort
data.value: Determines usage of index files

data.name: ThresholdLong
data.value: As files are changed, some data stored at the remote destination may not be required. This option controls how much wasted space the destination can contain before being reclaimed. This value is a percentage used on each volume and the total storage.

data.name: ThresholdShort
data.value: The maximum wasted space in percent

data.name: DryrunLong
data.value: This option can be used to experiment with different settings and observe the outcome without changing actual files.

data.name: DryrunShort
data.value: Does not perform any modifications

data.name: BlockhashalgorithmLong
data.value: This is a very advanced option! This option can be used to select a block hash algorithm with smaller or larger hash size, for performance or storage space reasons.

data.name: BlockhashalgorithmShort
data.value: The hash algorithm used on blocks

data.name: FilehashalgorithmLong
data.value: This is a very advanced option! This option can be used to select a file hash algorithm with smaller or larger hash size, for performance or storage space reasons.

data.name: FilehashalgorithmShort
data.value: The hash algorithm used on files

data.name: NoautocompactLong
data.value: If a large number of small files are detected during a backup, or wasted space is found after deleting backups, the remote data will be compacted. Use this option to disable such automatic compacting and only compact when running the compact command.

data.name: NoautocompactShort
data.value: Disable automatic compating

data.name: SmallfilesizeLong
data.value: When examining the size of a volume in consideration for compating, a small tolerance value is used, by default 20 percent of the volume size. This ensures that large volumes which may have a few bytes wasted space are not downloaded and rewritten.

data.name: SmallfilesizeShort
data.value: Volume size threshold

data.name: SmallfilemaxcountLong
data.value: To avoid filling the remote storage with small files, this value can force grouping small files. The small volumes will always be combined when they can fill an entire volume.

data.name: SmallfilemaxcountShort
data.value: Maximum number of small volumes

data.name: PatchwithlocalblocksLong
data.value: Enable this option to look into other files on this machine to find existing blocks. This is a fairly slow operation but can limit the size of downloads.

data.name: PatchwithlocalblocksShort
data.value: Use local file data when restoring

data.name: NolocaldbShort
data.value: Disables the local database

data.name: NolocaldbLong
data.value: When listing contents or when restoring files, the local database can be skipped. This is usually slower, but can be used to verify the actual contents of the remote store

data.name: KeepversionsShort
data.value: Keep a number of versions

data.name: KeepversionsLong
data.value: Use this option to set number of versions to keep, supply -1 to keep all versions

data.name: KeeptimeShort
data.value: Keep all versions within a timespan

data.name: KeeptimeLong
data.value: Use this option to set the timespan in which backups are kept.

data.name: AllowmissingsourceShort
data.value: Ignore missing source elements

data.name: AllowmissingsourceLong
data.value: Use this option to continue even if some source entries are missing.

data.name: DownloadedFileSizeError
data.value: The file {0} was downloaded and had size {1} but the size was expected to be {2}

data.name: OverwriteShort
data.value: Overwrite files when restoring

data.name: OverwriteLong
data.value: Use this option to overwrite target files when restoring, if this option is not set the files will be restored with a timestamp and a number appended.

data.name: VerboseShort
data.value: Output more progress information

data.name: VerboseLong
data.value: Use this option to increase the amount of output generated when running an option. Generally this option will produce a line for each file processed.

data.name: UploadverificationfileShort
data.value: Determine if verification files are uploaded

data.name: UploadverificationfileLong
data.value: Use this option to upload a verification file after changing the remote storage. The file is not encrypted and contains the size and SHA256 hashes of all the remote files and can be used to verify the integrity of the files.

data.name: BackendtestsamplesShort
data.value: The number of samples to test after a backup

data.name: BackendtestsamplesLong
data.value: After a backup is completed, some files are selected for verification on the remote backend. Use this option to change how many. If this value is set to 0 or the option --{0} is set, no remote files are verified

data.name: FilereadbuffersizeShort
data.value: Size of the file read buffer

data.name: FilereadbuffersizeLong
data.value: Use this size to control how many bytes a read from a file before processing

data.name: AllowpassphrasechangeShort
data.value: Allow the passphrase to change

data.name: AllowpassphrasechangeLong
data.value: Use this option to allow the passphrase to change, note that this option is not permitted for a backup or repair operation
